description: Discover and analyze technologies across key dimensions, then compare options side-by-side to spot the best fit. Get tailored stack recommendations for your projectâ€™s type, scale, and priorities. Create and manage reusable blueprints to align teams and accelerate delivery.

capabilities.name: list_technologies
capabilities.description: Browse the complete catalog of 32 technologies across 8 categories (frontend, backend, meta-framework, database, orm, auth, hosting, payments). Each technology has deterministic scores across 6 dimensions. Use this to discover valid technology IDs before using analyze_tech or compare_techs. Data version: 2.4.0

capabilities.name: analyze_tech
capabilities.description: Get a comprehensive analysis of any technology with scores across 6 dimensions: performance (perf), developer experience (dx), ecosystem maturity, maintainability (maintain), cost efficiency, and compliance/security. Returns overall grade (A+ to C-), identified strengths and weaknesses. All scores are deterministic - no LLM hallucinations.

capabilities.name: compare_techs
capabilities.description: Compare 2-4 technologies side-by-side with per-dimension score breakdown, overall rankings with grades, and a compatibility matrix showing how well technologies work together. Perfect for making informed technology decisions. Example: compare ["nextjs", "sveltekit", "remix"] to find the best meta-framework for your project.

capabilities.name: recommend_stack_demo
capabilities.description: Get a complete tech stack recommendation for your project type. Returns the highest-scored technology for each category (frontend, backend, meta-framework, database, ORM, auth, hosting, payments) based on deterministic scoring algorithms. FREE demo with 1 request per day limit. For unlimited access with custom priorities and constraints, upgrade to Pro at stacksfinder.com.

capabilities.name: check_mcp_compatibility
capabilities.description: Check compatibility between MCP servers. Detects conflicts (e.g., two database providers), redundancies (e.g., two ORMs), and synergies (e.g., GitHub + Vercel). Returns a health score (0-100) with grade (A/B/C/D) and detailed breakdown.

capabilities.name: get_workflow_guide
capabilities.description:
Intelligent workflow guide that recommends the next tool to use based on your goal and context.

**Tier**: Free (no API key required)

**When to use**:
- You're unsure which StacksFinder tool to call next
- You want to understand the recommended workflow for your goal
- You need help navigating Pro vs Free features

**Supported Goals**:
- discover: Explore available technologies
- setup_api_key: Get Pro features access
- get_recommendation: Get a stack recommendation
- audit_project: Audit technical debt
- migrate_stack: Get migration recommendations
- install_mcp: Set up MCP in your IDE
- compare_techs: Compare technologies side-by-side
- create_blueprint: Create and save a blueprint

**Example**: get_workflow_guide({ current_goal: "audit_project", user_tier: "free" })

capabilities.name: recommend_stack
capabilities.description: Get a full tech stack recommendation with custom priorities and constraints. Unlike the demo version, this uses the complete scoring engine with weight adjustments. Requires Pro account.

capabilities.name: get_blueprint
capabilities.description: Fetch an existing blueprint by ID. Blueprints are generated via the StacksFinder web UI or create_blueprint tool. Returns the full tech stack recommendation with narratives.

capabilities.name: list_blueprints
capabilities.description: List your saved blueprints. Returns up to 50 most recent blueprints with their IDs, project names, and creation dates.

capabilities.name: get_audit
capabilities.description: Fetch an existing tech debt audit report by ID. Returns findings with severity (critical/high/medium/low/info) and actionable suggestions.

capabilities.name: list_audits
capabilities.description: List your tech debt audit reports. Shows name, status, health score, and creation date.

capabilities.name: get_audit_quota
capabilities.description: Check your remaining audit quota for this month. Shows used/limit and reset date.

capabilities.name: create_blueprint
capabilities.description: Create a new tech stack blueprint for a project. The blueprint generation is asynchronous. Returns job ID to poll for completion.

capabilities.name: create_audit
capabilities.description: Create a technical debt audit for a list of technologies. Analyzes for deprecated packages, security vulnerabilities, EOL versions.

capabilities.name: compare_audits
capabilities.description: Compare two audit reports to track technical debt trends over time. Shows new issues, resolved issues, and health score change.

capabilities.name: get_migration_recommendation
capabilities.description: Analyze an audit report for migration opportunities. Returns recommended replacements, migration roadmap, and risk assessment.

capabilities.name: generate_mcp_kit
capabilities.description: Generate a complete project kit with optimal tech stack and MCP recommendations based on project description.

capabilities.name: analyze_repo_mcps
capabilities.description: Analyze repository to detect tech stack and recommend relevant MCP servers. Note: This tool works best with local CLI, not via ChatGPT.

capabilities.name: prepare_mcp_installation
capabilities.description: Generate a .env-mcp configuration file for MCP server installation. Note: This tool works best with local CLI.

capabilities.name: execute_mcp_installation
capabilities.description: Read .env-mcp and generate installation commands for MCPs. Note: This tool works best with local CLI.

capabilities.name: estimate_project
capabilities.description: Estimate scope, pricing, and analyze market for a software project. Returns hour breakdown, price ranges, and risk assessment.

capabilities.name: get_estimate_quota
capabilities.description: Check your remaining estimate quota for this week and month.

capabilities.name: setup_api_key
capabilities.description: Create an API key for your StacksFinder account. For ChatGPT OAuth users: pass any value for email/password (e.g., "oauth@stacksfinder.com" / "oauth") - they are ignored when OAuth is active. Requires Pro or Team tier.

capabilities.name: list_api_keys
capabilities.description: List your StacksFinder API keys.

capabilities.name: revoke_api_key
capabilities.description: Revoke an API key. This action cannot be undone.

capabilities.name: create_api_key
capabilities.description: Create a new API key for your StacksFinder account. Uses OAuth authentication automatically - no email/password required. Requires Pro or Team tier.
